ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia on EEG, and developmental delay forming the diagnostic triad. The multiple seizure types and EEG abnormalities strongly support this diagnosis.
Common cause of infantile spasms with multiple seizure types, developmental delay, and can present with relative macrocephaly. TSC1 mutation-related form.
TSC2 mutation-related form, similar presentation to TSC1 but may have more severe neurological manifestations including infantile spasms and multiple seizure types.
Early-onset epileptic encephalopathy with infantile spasms, multiple seizure types, severe developmental delay, and hypotonia. More common in females.
Can present with infantile epileptic encephalopathy, multiple seizure types including spasms, developmental delay, and hypotonia.
Early infantile epileptic encephalopathy with multiple seizure types, including spasms, severe developmental delay, and hypotonia.
X-linked disorder causing infantile spasms, multiple seizure types, developmental delay, and can present with relative macrocephaly in males.
SCN1A-related severe epilepsy with multiple seizure types, developmental delay, though infantile spasms are less typical than other seizure types.
